intro: Centaurea scabiosifolia, commonly known as the Scabiousleaf Centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring wiry stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers with yellow centers, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky habitats. Centaurea scabiosifolia is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
